  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: BULK PERSON NOTICES LEAKING PACKAGE ON IRREG TRAIN CART AND NOTIFIES SUPERVISOR. SUPERVISOR NOTIFES RMP AND RMP SENDS DOWN DESIGNATED RESPONDER TO THE LOCATION OF THE SPILL. DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVES AT THE SCENE WITH PROPER PROTECTION EQUIPMENT ON AND STOCKED SPILL CART. DESIGNATED RESPONDER SUCCESSFULLY CONTAINS LEAKING PACKAGE.

item.title: Report E-2024050718
item.description:
Report E-2024050718

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-16
  • City: JOLIET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1-ounce of Ecolab Chore-Mate Laundry Detergent was released from (1) 20-gallon fiber drum due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted the shrink wrap around the drum only. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who stated they would clean it up themselves with the available PPE on site. The damaged container and impacted shrink wrap were placed into a poly drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024051709
item.description:
Report X-2024051709

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-28
  • City: MOKENA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The package was first discovered by package handler who notified QA (myself). It was wet and had a hole at a top corner of the box. The SAN-I-KING NO 451 solution was undeclared with no hazardous materials markings anywhere on outer container. The product was marked with a CORROSIVE 8 diamond label directly on the product packaging (along with UN1791 marking). Each of the 4 gallon bottles of SAN-I-KING demonstrated a small amount of leakage. No punctures/holes found in/on bottles. There was no inner packing. The bottles were placed inside a thin, unclosed bag.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: BULK BELT TENDER NOTICED LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE BELT. HE NOTIFES SUPERVISOR AND SUPERVISOR NOTIFIES RMP ABOUT SPILL. RMP SENDS DOWN DESIGNATED REPSONDER AND DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVES AT THE SCENE WITH PROPER PROTECTION EQUIPMENT ON AND STOCKED SPILL CART. RESPONDER SUCCESSFULLY CONTAINS LEAKING PACKAGE AND CLEANS UP REMAINING RESIDUE FROM LEAKAGE.

item.title: Report X-2024051457
item.description:
Report X-2024051457

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-22
  • City: MOKENA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Unknown when incident occurred. Leaking package was discovered by ops manager and staged for QA. It seems the damage was caught relatively quickly as there was no evidence of this spillage affecting any other packages. Inner packaging consisted of 2 2-pk corrugated cartons. The hazmat was undeclared for shipping and there were no labels or markings on the outermost container. SANI-I-KING NO. 451, UN1791, CORROSIVE 8 bottle had cap fully removed and entire contents leaked into outer container.

item.title: Report E-2024050646
item.description:
Report E-2024050646

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-20
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 20, 2024, two (2) 55-gallon drums of paint were damaged and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel utilized hand tools, and granular absorbents, to remediate the paint (UN1263)-impacted loading dock floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The two (2) damaged drums were overpacked into two (2) 85-gallon metal overpacks.

  • Description: It was reported that approximately 16-ounces of Rust-Oleum 9200 Industrial Coating Low Temp Epoxy was released from a 5-gallon metal pail due to improper blocking and bracing by termonalXNJ. The release impacted trailer #3111337. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site.

It was reported that a small amount of VideoJet V7206-D released from (1) 12-pound box due to it falling off the pallet as the dock worker was driving. The release was completely contained to the cardboard box it shipped in and nothing impacted the dock.
